title: Executive Assistant
description: As the Executive Assistant, you'll be the go-to support across scheduling, communication, documentation, research, light HR coordination, social media support, travel booking, and program administration. We are looking for a person who can juggle different priorities and get things done.
responsibilities: Manage and maintain executive calendars, scheduling, confirming, and preparing for meetings
Coordinate meetings (including cross-time zone), organize logistics, prepare agendas, and take notes
Support the creation, formatting, and design of slide decks and presentations
Post on company social media channels and coordinate asset gathering from the Design team
Draft, proofread, and send correspondence, memos, and summaries
Maintain organized electronic and physical filing systems
Assist with light candidate screening, interviewing scheduling, and job post creation
Work with leadership to gather requirements, build and update job descriptions
Follow up on outstanding invoices and assist with accounts receivable
Arrange domestic and international travel for executives/team members
Support and help administer programs and fellowships (including comms, scheduling, logistics)
Plan and help execute in-person and virtual events
Conduct research and provide analysis/briefs on various topics
General administrative work and special projects as assigned
Maintain confidentiality and demonstrate discretion on all sensitive matters
expectations: Passion for supporting teams and leaders, attention to detail, and delivering excellent administrative work. Superb written and verbal communication skills. Initiative, organization, reliability, and a strong sense of follow-through. Ability to work independently and adapt quickly to new tasks and priorities.

required: Experience as an executive assistant or similar support role, ideally for leaders or cross-functional teams
Excellent organization, scheduling, and time management abilities
Confidence with productivity tools (Microsoft Office Suite, Google Workspace, modern remote work tools)
Experience in administrative work, communications, basic HR/recruiting coordination, and travel support
Professionalism, adaptability, and commitment to confidentiality
bonus: Experience administering company programs or fellowships
Comfort posting on social media and working with design/marketing assets
Familiarity with invoices, and accounts receivable
Experience supporting fast-moving or startup teams
preferred: Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Experience supporting executives in fast-paced environments

green.flag: Experience with startup or tech company environments
Proven track record of managing complex calendars and travel arrangements

red.flag: High level and generic experience like "RAG", "Langchain", "Vector-Search"
